Commands.Body: Here you can read up on how to set up a <u><fontcolor[#FFFF0000]>Message Box</fontcolor></u>.
As well as the various Text Formatters, Control Sequences and Replacements.

A full list of those can be found on the <u><fontcolor[#FF00CFFF]>RPGA</fontcolor></u> Wiki Page for
<u>TextEscapeCodes</u>.
Interact with the Bookshelfs for more. To reach the Upper Section,
Interact with the Ladder to Bring it Down. Then Interact with it again to Cimb Up.
Section 1: Setting up a Message Box and a Dialogue Options Box User Interface.
Setting Up a Message Box is done within the Database - User Interface.
Select an Empty Slot and set the "User Interface Type" to "Message Box".
Then Scroll down until you see the Message Box Elements.

<displayall>Header Element
Body Element
Portrait Element
Prompt Element
The Header Element is where you set the Text displayed in the "Header Section" of the Display Static Message Command, essentially the Name of the Speaker.
Body Element is the main Message, where the written dialogue is placed. You make a new Text Element in the UI, hit the Green + to the Right.
From there you can Adjust the Various Settings to your liking, such as Height and Width of the Text Area. Font, Font Size, Color, Drop Shadow, Character Delay and such.
Once the Text Element has been created, you put that into the Body Element and that Text will be replaced by the Text used inside the Display Static Message Command.
Same thing for the Header Element, the Text Added in the Header Section of the Message Command will be placed in the Text linked to the Header Element.
Portrait Element is the same, except it is a Picture Element rather than a Text, if you set a Portrait in the Message Command, that will replace the Portrait set in the UI.
Prompt is set up the same way, it is however not a replacement, but is the sprite that will be displayed when the Message has concluded and you can proceed.
All off these Elements need to be set in the UI if you want to use them, if you make a portrait in the UI but does not link it to the Portrait Header, it will just be a static element on the screen.
